I have been told a lot in the last weeks that by voting for a third party is wasting my vote, do you think that is true, and if so why?
 Was it a waste of a vote if I voted for Kerry in Indiana, and if so why, or why not?

I have been told a lot in the last weeks that by voting for a third party is wasting my vote, do you think that is true, and if so why?
 Was it a waste of a vote if I voted for Kerry in Indiana, and if so why, or why not?

 
 Voting for a third party in this election was obviously diverting a vote to a candidate that had zero chance of winning. Based on that, it simply withheld a vote from Bush or Kerry. Strategically, I think you have to be a realist and ultimately vote for a candidate that you can live with AND has a legitimate chance of being elected even if they're not your optimal choice.

 Ok, if I had bothered to sit in line for a while I would not have voted for Bush or Kerry. Badnarik was even on our ballot and i would have voted for him if I gave a hoot. So if I actually took the time, he would have gotten one vote from me to add to the other 4,823 that he got here in Tennessee. Since I would never vote for Bush and voting for Kerry would have made me feel like an idiot I don't see how a vote for a third party candidate would divert a vote from either of them.
 
 It would have simply been a total waste of my time.
 
 .

Voting for a third party in this election was obviously diverting a vote to a candidate that had zero chance of winning.
 
 then voting for Kerry in Indiana is also a wasted vote, and voting for Bush in Ill. was a wasted vote.
 
 
I think you have to be a realist and ultimately vote for a candidate that you can live with AND has a legitimate chance of being elected even if they're not your optimal choice.
 
 why? before the other partys can get 10% they have to get 5%, before they cna get that, they need us to get sick of what choices we have.

Or, maybe every vote for Kerry was a vote wasted, since Nader or Badnarik were the better candidate. They could have been after all, for all the news coverage given to them. One day, a genuinely good presidential candidate will come along, and no one would ever find out if he/she wasn't a republicrat.

I don't think your vote is ever wasted. It may be that your candidate is never elected, but at least the winning candidate and the governing group will get an idea how many people think they way you do. They 'll start to listen when the numbers get big.
